beer.beer_description: This burnt ruby red malt bomb with a light floral note from our use of Challenger, East Kent Goldings, and our Cascade hops.   Weezy uses Maris Otter malt, Special B malt, flaked barley, and crystal 120L malt.
A cask version of our Prion Porter that was barrel aged in a Tenth Ward Distillery Applejack barrel.

Biscuity, Dry, Cherry. Patersbiers were traditionally brewed by Monks to drink during their work day. Good for having one or two and still getting back to work. 

Hops: Horizon, Saaz

Malts: 2 Row, Pilsner, CaraVienne, CaraMunich

Starting Gravity 11.2

Final Gravity 3.1
A pumpkin ale that is sure to please the palate and keep you looking forward to cooler nights.

Imperial Chocolate Pumpkin Ale.  Just before the Civil War, a pumpkin blight bleached the Commonwealth's crop white, turning the gourds into twisted, fermenting skulls in the fields.  This chai-spiced ale is brewed in remembrance of "the year of the twisted gourd," pairing pumpkin puree with cacao to create a unique ale which won South Street a silver medal at the 2016 Great American Beer Festival!

For this Festbier, we stuck to the traditional side for this classic German style. This beer is robust, and full bodied, with an ABV to back it up. On the taste, you will notice a nice toasted breadiness, and a slight touch of malt sweetness. This is then balanced out with a slight charge of German hop flavors. We hope you enjoy this in celebration with loved ones for the changing season, Prost!

DUH-NUH-NUH-NUH-NUH-NUH-NUH-NUH, Kölschman! Here to rescue Cushwa beer drinkers from their need for a beer that is low in ABV and high in drinkability is Kölschman. Brewed traditionally to the German style, this beer pours straw yellow in color, with a bright clearness to it. The flavor is crisp and refined, while also still being balanced out with enough German hop characteristics and bitterness to leave you wanting more sips.
Smoked Wheat Grodziskie! A low 3.5% ABV combined with a mild and pleasant smoked wheat character, head retention for daaaaze, and a clean crisp thirst quenching finish.

This Belgian-style tripel is follows traditional brewing practices with the use of Belgian candied sugar as part of the fermentable sugars.  Golden in color, this beer has aromas of fruit and spice produced by the Belgian ale yeast during fermentation.

This elegant and malty German style Märzen is rich, toasty and bready with a moderately dry finish. Medium body with a smooth and creamy texture and low hop bitterness makes this beer perfectly balanced for Fall.

Brewed with delicious Choco Taco ice cream treats, this dark roasted imperial milk stout is gushing with vanilla ice cream, chocolate fudge, waffle cones and a slight hint of peanuts. *Contains lactose and peanuts*

Black is Beautiful is collaborative effort to raise awareness for the injustices people of color face daily and raise funds for police brutality reform and legal defenses for those who have been wronged.

Proceeds from our Black is Beautiful beer benefit The Sentencing Project, a 501(c)(3) organization focused on addressing racial disparities within the United States criminal justice system.

Bitburger Triple Hop’d Lager is a beautiful harmony of German and American brewing styles. Brewed in collaboration by Bitburger & Sierra Nevada, this 5.8% dry-hopped lager is full of grapefruit citrus and aromatic fruit notes, balanced by a pleasant bitter finish and light malt backbone .

Hops: Eifel-Cascade, Bitburger Siegelhopfen, Chinook, Centennial
Butter Pecan Nut Brown Ale

This beer was brewed to be more like the Porters of old. It's very dark brown in color with an aroma of light smoke and wet tobacco as a result of the dry hopping.  You'll find bittersweet dark chocolate and light roast in the flavor accompanied by a medium light body.

For our take on the Brew for BAM collaborative effort, we chose to mix it up.  We wanted to highlight our love for hoppy beer, but also our drive to explore new ingredients and processes.  We took an India Pale Lager base, utilized a clean Kviek strain called Lutra, and fermented it warm.  Amazingly clean lager-esque flavors are then coupled with a heavy dose of Falconer's Flight and Vic Secret dry hops.  Smooth, crisp and hoppy!

For this traditional take on a classic style, we harnessed our German roots.  This Vienna lager pours amber in color with a fluffy white head.  It offers rich and bready maltiness and a hint of toast... all balanced by restrained and deliberate noble hop additions.  This clean, crisp and very tasty lager is ideal for enjoying on an equally beautiful late summer or fall day. Prost!
A true Farmhouse Saison made with orange peel and coriander.
Four kinds of grains, three different hops, two yeast strains, and one beer.
A Vienna style lager.  This dark, malty lager has a hint of chocolate and a smooth, dry finish.

A bold, smooth-bodied concoction with dark- roasted coffee aromas give way to semi-sweet chocolate.  We round out this velvety delight with a dose of flaked oatmeal for a creamy body and a semi-dry finish.

This Dunkel was brewed to be traditional in style. This Munich Dunkel, a German dark lager, pours light caramel in color. The beer is driven by a smooth malty flavor. The low ABV makes it inviting to return for another.
This beer carries aromas of jolly rancher candy, pineapple, and light evergreen.  It has a medium mouthfeel, with a lactose sweetness.  It reminds us of peach smoothie and strawberry oatmeal.
A deliciously creamy brown ale with a toasty, warm finish and hints of nut flavor. Named after the longest living tree at Antietam Battlefield.
We brewed this with a very heavy dose of Spelt in the grist and used all Southern Hemisphere hops to create a dry, but fruity, easy drinking Pale Ale.

beer.beer_name: Green Farmer Pale Ale No. 15 SMASH
beer.beer_description: SMASH (single malt and single hop) is a simple and straight forward recipe to showcase the fantastic terroir of Maryland agriculture. Crisp, clean and smooth with notes of herbaceous citrus make this Summer in a glass! Pilsner malt from Dark Cloud Malthouse and Brewers Gold hops from Black Locust hop farm make up this delicious 100% Maryland grown Pale Ale.

This DIPA brings the ?.  Brewed with fresh picked habaneros that we threw into the boil.  We then dry-hopped with pineapple forward hops (Azacca and Sultana).  We amplified the experience by letting the beer sit on a mix of habanero and pineapple purees until perfectly balanced.  A touch sweet, a tad spicy, but not over the top and definitely a beer that will keep you coming back for more.

A robust rye porter with hints of coffee and chocolate nicely balanced with a subtle hop influence. A substantial, malty ale, complex and flavorful with a medium body and a slightly roasty finish. The rich dark color is deceptively refreshing. The spice in the rye clears the palate. A sip will explain why we say this is a delightful combination of sweet and spicy!
A traditional American Amber Ale. Easy drinking beer with delicious maltiness.
A traditional Mexican style lager. Clean, Smooth, and can be served with a lime.
The second runnings from our Black is Beautiful brew brought us this fabulous little beer! Roasty, full bodied and complex, this Belgian Brown Ale is the perfect transition to Fall!

We teamed up with our friends at Olde Mother Brewing and Darkcloud malthouse to create this unique offering.
The use of an experimental Norwegian yeast strain produces a smoothness reminiscent of a lager. This really lets the local malt character shine with earthy, bready, farmhouse complexity. Proceeds of this beer to benefit the Brewers Association of Maryland the non-profit trade organization representing Maryland breweries.

We are proud to participate in the Black Is Beautiful initiative started by Weathered Souls Brewing. This Russian Imperial Stout is bold and complex with notes of dark roasted coffee and sweet roast with a lingering bitter finish. Proceeds from this beer will be donated to the Maryland State Conference of the NAACP.
Crisp, Fresh, Sour
The 2019 rendition of our Imperial Stout. This is beer is aged is aged in Whiskey barrels and only comes out once a year. The rich chocolate notes are balanced by the Oak flavors of the barrel.
This beer is a take on our original Fog at Daybreak recipe using a French yeast strain that adds additional lemon notes and a clean aroma finish.

This is a relatively complex beer that is malty, rich, and nutty on the palate. The aroma presents a light caramel sweetness with a hint of dark fruit.  It has the perfect amount of English hops added for balance.

Extra Pale Ale brewed with tons of spelt & raw wheat for a smooth mouthfeel despite the low ABV. Aggressively hopped with Samba, Sabro, Enigma, and Hopsteiner Experimental Hop #07270 for notes of lemon meringue, black currant jam, ripe mango, and just a touch of bitter grapefruit.
A refreshing pale ale for those living an active lifestyle.  Oliver craft brewery, proudly brewing craft beer in Baltimore since 1993. Keep cold, drink fresh.

Incredibly flavorful abbey ale inspired by the everyday beers enjoyed by Trappist monks. Soft golden color and an intense, spicy Belgian yeast profile. All the character of a hop-forward, yeast-driven Belgian ale without the higher alcohol.
Wunderbar! Beautiful copper color. German Pilsner Malt balancing Magnum and Perle Hops (the most popular hop in Germany). Creating a crisp quality, a toasty flavor and slight caramel-like sweetness.

Marry smooth roast with luscious malt and you get rich caramel, dark chocolate, and coffee. Tropical stout is brewed from the Caribbean to Asia. Pour yourself one, take a sip, and feel like you are relaxing in the warmth of a tropical sun.

Our take on a British Summer Ale! We used our usual house English strain, but rather than load up on citrusy American or Southern Hemisphere hops we added just a touch of earthy Styrian Goldings from Slovenia. For malt, the simplicity of 100% Scottish Golden Promise adds a slightly biscuity fullness.

We may have gotten a little carried away by our love of vanilla... for this 15 gallon variant we added 12 Ugandan vanilla beans to our bourbon-barrel-aged brown ale. The result smells like brownie batter, with the fudgy combination of dark malts and vanilla!
Our first Hazy IPA. This has lactose, flakes barley, sweet orange peel, and lots of citrusy hops like Mandarina Bavaria.

We took fresh, locally harvested oyster shells and added them to the brewing process of this Irish-style dry stout. The shells impart a mineral quality to the beer as well as enhancing the overall flavor. We dispense this with nitrogen rather than traditional Co2 to give it a smooth, creamy mouthfeel.

Named for the large, hairy creature that is said to inhabit the ranges New Zealand's North Island, the Moehau is said to resemble North America's Bigfoot. This IPA utilizes only New Zealand hops throughout the brewing process to give it a tropical, citrusy and juicy flavor and aroma.
This Stout is brewed with lactose and crab shells from JM Clayton, a 5th generation family owned crab processor in Cambridge, MD. The salts from the shells give it a nice and smooth roundness.

A pale yellow, crisp lager with a light hop aroma and malty finish. Uses German Pilsner malt, Carahell malt, Caravienne malt, and Carapils malt. Hopped with Thanksgiving Farm’s Cascade hops to balance the malt and give it just a touch of citrus flavor.

Our flagship beer is an American pale ale and brown ale hybrid, a beer I developed early in my homebrewing career. It uses Maris Otter malt, brown malt, medium British crystal malt, and flaked oats and is bittered with Bravo and Columbus hops (Columbus is from Thanksgiving Farm) and dry hopped with a blend of Citra and Calypso hops. These ingredients provide a big citrusy hop aroma balanced with the bready notes of the brown malt. And, at 4.4% ABV, makes for a great session ale!

Brewed with 300 habanero and aji peppers selected for their bright citrus notes, this session is hoppy and crisp with the perfect amount of heat. We then dry hopped with Mosaic (what?!) and Cascade for a great pineapple aroma that leads to a dry and slightly bitter finish.
Mild Ale with a dark amber color, and lightly hopped with some sweetness.
Elementary is a study in contradiction. The simplicity of a few ingredients yielding an incredibly complex beer. Tasting includes notes of dark chocolate, coffee, caramel and a roasty finish.

Sierra Nevada Torpedo Ale is a big American IPA; bold, assertive and full of flavor and aromas highlighting the complex citrus, pine and herbal character of whole-cone American hops. Our obsession with harnessing huge hop flavor led to the development of what we call the hop torpedo, a revolutionary method of dry-hopping designed, built, and debuted here at the brewery. Our torpedo is a sleek, stainless-steel piece of hardware that delivers more pure hop aroma than any method of dry-hopping we’ve ever seen.

Black IPA. Uses American 2-row pale malt. Carafoam, Carafa Special III, aromatic, and black malt to provide the same needs to balance the bittering hops yet let's the aroma hops shine. Bittering hops are Warrior, Centennial, Amarillo, and Summit with Citra and Cascade (from Thanksgiving Farms) used in the whirlpool. Black Death was dry hopped with Galaxy, Chinook, Citra, Summit, and Amarillo.
NE IPA w/lactose

This soft, well balanced DIPA is hopped exclusively with Citra and El Dorado.  It has an aroma of citrus and juicy fruit with the resiny flavor of citrus peel matched with a light hard candy sweetness.

A substantial, malty dark ale with a complex and flavorful roasty, chocolatey character. Uses American 2-Row Pale Malt, Brown Malt, Medium British Crystal Malt (55L), Black Malt, Chocolate Malt, and roasted Barley. Hopped with Thanksgiving Farm's Nugget Hops to balance the Malt sweetness.

American Robust Porter with Maryland Cascade hops, Zeus hops, black patent malt, chocolate malt and Chico yeast. The dark chocolate and molasses nose is complimented by a slight hop fruitiness creating a comforting and complex finish with a touch of sweetness.
The restrained roasted characters of this Black IPA meld wonderfully with the large amount of Chinook, Simcoe, Columbus, and Lemondrop hops.

Dry Irish Stout with Maryland Cascade hops, roasted barley, flaked barley and Chico yeast. This traditional Dry Stout has notes of coffee and dark chocolate with low hop bitterness and a smooth and dry finish.

With over 400 pounds of wild fermented foeder aged Maryland grown yellow plums, this Farmhouse has notes of delicate funky fruit on the nose that lead to ripe yellow plum with a touch of bright acidity on the palate. The foeder was made from an Old Westminster wine barrel!

Photon is our light and crushable American Pale Ale loaded with pacific northwest hops. It pours a very hazy orange, releasing well-blended notes of apricot, tangerine, peach, mango, and pineapple. It tastes of soft juicy tropical fruits, hop resins, and a hint of biscuit. A smooth rounded bitterness with a touch of dryness ensures you’re ready for the next sip. This drinking experience is further enhanced with a soft and billowy mouth-feel that has made this the go to ale for the Equilibrium crew, especially when a productive day needs to follow a fun night.
Huge amounts of roasted barley and chocolate come together in a surprisingly smooth and drinkable stout. Bring out the heavy artillery!
A hop cocktail of Simcoe, Mosaic, and Amarillo.  Aroma is sticky, tropical resin.  Finish is clean and dry.  All the hop flavor you would expect from a DIPA packed into a sessionable pale.

This is an example of an Irish style called “Dry Stout”. It is a very drinkable beer; not being so strong that it quickly becomes satiating, but rich and complex enough to remain interesting pint after pint. The balance of this beer is towards the malt character, as opposed to the hop character. The nature of the malts used lend very distinctive roasted, caramel, and coffee-like notes to the beer. These are very pronounced in the aroma, but not overbearing in the taste or finish. The hop aroma is subtle and the hop bitterness is apparent only in its use as balance for the malt character.

This style is our annual St. Patrick's Day release.

We took a base of both pale ale and Vienna malts and added touches of carapils and honey malt to build up a slightly sweet malty backbone.  

We added freshly smoked jalapenos, orange blossoms and a floral/citrus blend of American hops. This beer has a touch of heat, finishes clean and drives you for just another sip!

Developed alongside over a dozen Single-Hop Imperial IPAs. The truth was three years in the making and has some of the most unique hop varieties available today.

The Truth's sharp hop bitterness begins with pine on the nose and evolves into bright citrus and subtle stone fruit flavors. Pair this beer with sharp cheddar cheese and light, spicy proteins.

This all Citra Double IPA is bright with a strong tropical citrus aroma and notes of pineapple and papaya for days. We went heavy handed with each dry hop addition while still giving this beer a smooth and delicate backend finish you crave.
This German style wheat beer (weissbier) produces unique flavors of banana and cloves with an often dry and tart edge.
Single hopped pale ale. hopped in boil and dry hopped with Ekuanot hops. Giving flavors and aroma of melon, papaya, and a hint of green pepper on the back end.
An easy drinking beer with subtle flavors. Malty with toffee and caramel sweetness.
A traditional Helles lager. Pale, crisp, and clean. A touch of german spuce with grwat malty balance. A beer for lovers of beer!

Famous for its rich amber color and medium-bodied flavor with roasted caramel malt for a subtle sweetness and a combination of cluster and cascade hops, this true original delivers a well-balanced taste with very distinct character. Born from a historic recipe that was resurrected in 1987, Yuengling Traditional Lager is a true classic.

Learn more: http://www.yuengling.com/lager

Pine and resin complement a crisp nose with citrus and spruce notes to round out the well-balanced palate. This Pale Ale is brewed with 100% MD grown ingredients including Vienna & Pale malt from Dark Cloud Malthouse, Nugget and Cascade hops!

This Porter is a just a bit bigger than our standard, but not quite "imperial".  We brewed this beer based on one of our Vermont friend's recipes (Thanks Fogg!).  It has whole Bali coffee beans from River Bottom Roasters and madagascar vanilla bean additions.
This delicious little nugget is brewed with lactose, vanilla and toasted marshmallow because we wanted to.

Modeled after a famous creamy chocolate mousse candy bar, we threw a ton of chocolate malt into the mix, a good amount of lactose and a fair amount of Madagascar Vanilla bean.  We finished this beer on lightly roasted cacao nibs for a creamy, chocolaty smooth milk stout.

Y’all. Apiary is so good!! We are thrilled with the way this 100% MD bìere de miel (honey beer) turned out. This beer has wonderful full body that is beautifully complimented by chamomile and local lavender from Serene Lavender Farm for a perfect Spring finish! At 4.8% abv, she’s perfect for patio sippin’ or working in the garden!
A clean and crisp, traditional dark German lager.  The aroma has notes of light roast coffee and dark chocolate.  The flavor is bread crust and roast, with a dry finish.

Hints of melon and citrus on the nose, hopped with Madarina Bavaria, Palisade and Amarillo. Light bodied and flavorful, notes of orange zest and tropical fruit give way to a hint of biscuit malt. 104 calories per 12oz serving.
Falconers Flight Hopped
A smooth, silky, classic hazy IPA which is soon to be a hit for everyone who tries it. It's named in honor of Patsy Cline who once graced the stage in Brunswick
A dark IPA with a cascading tawny head. Its light fruity aroma leads to its robust Citra and Centennial hop taste. Looks like a stout, but drinks like an IPA.

An American Porter that is layered with chocolate malts with a slightly sweet vanilla nose.

We finished the beer on both toasted coconut and coconut cream for a deep and dimensional experience.

The mix of Vic Secret, Azacca and Sultana bring about bright notes of ruby red grapefruit, pineapple, passion fruit, tangerine and pine with a mellow, restrained, bitterness that allows the smooth, creamy, body to support the beer through to your next sip. 
So come and grab your Liquid Lunch, while it's hot!

Our flagship barrel-aged project; this Russian Imperial Stout was designed from the ground up to optimize the nine-month aging process. Resolute greets you with a thick, chocolaty head followed by an unbelievably complex harmony of vanilla, oak, chocolate, espresso, and a rich malty base that each clamor for your attention. Resolute is the embodiment of our commitment to you.

Produced in the tradition of 18th Century English brewers who supplied the court of Russia’s Catherine the Great, Old Rasputin seems to develop a cult following wherever it goes. It’s a rich, intense brew with big complex flavors and a warming finish.

beer.beer_name: Future You Hates You [Cushwa Brewing Collaboration] (Ghost 825)
beer.beer_description: Intense aromas of Dark Chocolate, Coffee, Thick with a Roasted Character that dominates, Earthy, Leather, Tobacco, Full Bodied with just enough Bitterness to Balance
The follow up brew to Dude Mountain. Same base brown ale recipe but this time flavored with hazelnut pralines!

We took our Imperial Nut Brown and chucked in a bunch of maple pralines, then aged it in McClintock Bourbon barrels for 3 months.

This beer is malty, sweet, smooth and boozy with distinct notes of maple, caramel, vanilla and oak!

Very limited so get it while it lasts!

Brewed in collaboration with Hysteria Brewing Co.  This IPA is brewed with a mix of both pale and Munich malts, highlighted with a touch of dehusked Carafa malt and a touch of chocolate wheat for a decidedly dark brew.  

We turned the style upside down by hopping it exclusively with Cryo hops...  Citra, Mosaic and Simcoe to be exact.  This should be an amalgamation of roasty and fruity flavors sure to please the most discerning palates.
Imperial stout aged in a Rye Whiskey Barrel

For pickle addicts, this mind-bending fusion of salty and sour is a really, really big dill. A masterfully-crafted gose with a healthy dose of pickling spices, Hidden Pickle is a love letter to the Frankenstein of the vegetable world. While an ordinary person eats a pickle with their burger and fries, an extraordinary person drinks one.
Smoked Barleywine aged in Sagamore Rye Whiskey barrels for 13 months. Big and bold with beautifully balanced notes of whiskey soaked leather, warm oak, caramelized plums, vanilla and rich malt.

This malty lager is our most award-winning beer: it took gold, silver, and bronze medals at the Great American Beer Festival from 2006 to 2010. Cutlass Amber has a toasted, biscuity character. The slight sweetness comes from Crystal malt. Vienna malt contributes a remarkable smoothness and Munich malt gives an amber color and delicate aroma. Tettnang hops infuse the beer with a slight earthiness. Formerly named Heavy Seas Märzen, Cutlass Amber is our second best-selling beer. In 2012, Cutlass Amber won a silver medal at the World Beer Cup in the Vienna Lager category.

Our smooth bodied porter bolstered by lactose and infused with a blend of fresh Madagascar Bourbon Vanilla and Indian Vanilla beans. Dark and rich with a creamy vanilla flavor and roasty chocolate finish.
A light amber winter bock with a smooth malty flavor and a light hop finish.

This incredibly aromatic and refreshing warm-weather seasonal is brewed with Tangerine peel! It will pour an orange body crowned by a pillowy white head. A slightly tart first sip is complemented nicely by sweet citrus fruit flavors and a mild bready backbone in the finish. It is best enjoyed directly out of a can among friends and sunshine!
Sweet bursts of blackberry & honeysuckle harminoize in this fruity, floral, & slightly tart sour with earthy undertones. A taste of spring, no matter the weather.

This is a beer hopped with Citra Hops and flavored with fresh grapefruit, salt and juniper berries in the boil.  Then dry hopped with fresh grapefruit, dried grapefruit peel and juniper berries.  It is inspired by the Salty Dog cocktail which incorporates gin, grapefruit juice with a salted rim.
Dank

A collaboration with The Friendly Fermenter. One base porter recipe, with a different version at each brewery. Inspired by our favorite Friendly Fermenter beers, our version features honey and almonds.

Hop-forward beers weren’t popular when we started brewing in 1980. But we loved them, and knew that if we were going to open a brewery, we’d better make something distinctive. It’s been 40 years since then, and we’re still brewing what we love. This beer showcases the bold flavors and aromas of a classic West Coast IPA: intense pine and citrus with a deep gold color and slight caramel sweetness. Here’s to following your passion, and to the next 40 years.
A mix between a Hefeweizen and a Dunkel Lager giving it a delicious balance of clove and roasted German malt

We aged this one for over 3 months in A. Smith Bowman whiskey barrels...and then we added sweet and sour cherries to create a bourbon-soaked, fruity vanilla sensation you can only experience on tap in our tasting room.
Smooth British-style stout with notes of chocolate and raisins on Nitro
Rye Porter aged in Sagamore Rye Whiskey barrels for 10 months. Velvety mouthfeel with notes of whiskey, wood, vanilla, and roasty malt.

As brewers, we get the privilege to sample our beers straight from the tanks in all their raw glory. Some beers need a little polishing to get ready to go out into the world, while others—the hop-heavy, rowdy, crowd-pleasers—should just be left alone. We wanted to share this brewery-only treat with you, so we present this Hazy Little Thing, our unfiltered, unprocessed IPA, straight from the tanks and into the can.
Collab with Goonda Beersmiths, Whitey's liquor and Goetze's caramels! Brewed with the iconic candy

Squeeze those hops for all they're worth and prepare to pucker up: Nugget Nectar Ale, will take hopheads to nirvana with a heady collection of Nugget, Warrior and Tomahawk hops. Starting with the same base ingredients of our flagship HopBack Amber Ale, Nugget Nectar intensifies the malt and hop flavors to create an explosive hop experience.
Brewed with Hallertauer Mittlefrueh hops.

We aged a caramel-forward imperial stout in South American rum barrels with a few vanilla beans. When it was ready we blended in 20% of a fresh batch of extra-roasty imperial stout. The result exudes brown sugar, butter-rum, and coffee notes.

For our first dubbel we stuck close to the classic style. We combined Belgian malts ranging from ultra-light Pilsner to raisiny Special B with caramely dark candi syrup. We employed a classic Belgian strain from a famous monastery-brewery to create a balanced peppered-banana character. Low hopping, as this beer finishes relatively dry compared to most of our beers.

Gonzo is big, bold, and beautiful like the man it was brewed in honor of – Dr. Hunter S. Thompson. Flavor notes: Roasted chocolate, coffee, and vanilla malt flavors balanced with a unique hop bite Pairs with: Mushrooms; smoked meats, BBQ, and chili; hard cheese; chocolate and coffee desserts

"It never got weird enough for me."
-Hunter S. Thompson
Gonzo Imperial Porter aged in whiskey barrels with tart and sweet cherries.
Aged for over 3 months in South American rum barrels, this beer will wrap your taste buds in warm, spicy deep dark malty goodness.
Aged for over 3 months in A. Smith Bowman bourbon barrels, deep oak, vanilla, and chocolate notes round out a bad and BOOZY rarity that only comes but once a year.

Based on an original recipe from 1795, Very Bad Elf has nutty and sweet-roasted flavors attributable to its use of an ancient pale malt, uniquely recreated for this delightful ale. A rare variety of Fuggles hops dating to the mid-1800’s gives the beer a soft, rounded bitterness and uncanny drinkability.

In a sea of lagers and kolschs, the Cream Ale is quickly becoming a popular summer brew. To pay respect to the style's humble roots, we created a “pre-prohibition” recipe that is light, refreshing, and flavorful. This one is awesome in its simplicity: barley, corn, and a touch of caramel malt for sweetness.  We then used Mt. Hood hops to give that slightly spicy, grassy tone often found in the roots of fine light(er) beers. Topped of with subtle hints of lemon, Crooked Cream Ale is the perfect companion on a hot summer day. Please drink and mow responsibly.
Porter conditioned on top of toasted almonds

Generously hopped with Enigma, Simcoe and Vic Secret, and textured with wheat and oats to add a fluffy softness to this NEIPA. A haze of fresh picked oranges, ripe bananas, and tropical fruit whisks you from barstool to cabana. And, seeped with the warmth of Green Tea to recall the bitter wintry reality.
A self explanatory delicious ale all around. This is our take on it!

This crisp clean dark lager begins with hints of roasted coffee beans and rich chocolate but showcases a surprisingly light body and mouthfeel. This Schwarzbier (German for “Black Beer”) is moderately hopped with Noble German hops that complement the delicate malt backbone. Not to be underestimated this light lager is a true champion of flavor! Caw!

Peach Kick is an ode to our harvest time in Colorado. A blend of our world class woood-aged sours and a golden ale infused with peaches, it's perfectly balanced for easy-drinking, tongue-tingling excitement.

Worlds Converge: two breweries- one from the wilds of downtown Silver Spring and one from the bucolic feilds of Howard County- came together to give you this delicious India Pale Lager. We converged old-world lager traditions with modern American IPA brewing techniques for a crisp, super-drinkable lager with big hop flavor and aroma.
Toffee Porter

beer.beer_name: Barrel Aged Pale Saison: Brett Lambicus
beer.beer_description: Aged in a red wine barrel for twenty months with Brettanomyces lambicus, the delicious beer boasts a beautiful aroma of oak, fruitiness and saison spice. The wild yeast brings just the right amount of funk without overwhelming the palate with tartness.

With fruity notes, low bitterness and a clean finish, this refreshing beer is hard to put down. Take it with you on your infinite adventures. No matter the journey, this is an ale you can enjoy 8 Days a Week.
Up front sweetness and silky texture rounded out by dry bittersweet chocolate tones. This one is going to come through like delicious chocolate milk.

beer.beer_name: The Bark Is Worse Than the Bite
beer.beer_description: The base beer for our collaboration with Pizza Boy (Enola, PA), is an Imperial Brown Ale. For kicks, we unleashed our resident spice wizard (Millhouse) to add his mojo to transform this beauty into a Birch Beer Brown. It pours a deep black crowned by a tan head. Various roots, barks and magic lend aromas and flavors of birch, sarsaparilla, licorice, sassafras and ginger to a very well-balanced brown ale.

Live Session is bright, refreshingly loud, and cracked up to 11 by adding generous amounts of Citra hops to reflect the feeling of live music. Live Session pairs great with toe-tapping or head-banging to your favorite band on stage.

ABV - 5.5%
Aroma - citrusy grapefruit notes, sweet malt
Color - light copper
Flavor - hops dominate, then mingle with malts & finish dry
Fermentation - ale yeas, four types of malt, four variety of hops
Bitterness - low to moderate 37 IBUs
Body - light-bodied
available year-round

This two year aged Pussy Pilot Parade is brewed at our little farmhouse brewery. It’s a BRIPA with a slightly dry, yet robust, malty body and a nice, citrusy finish. What’s a BRIPA? Stands for Black Rye India Pale Ale (aka Black Rye IPA). Black Rye IPAs are made with darker malts and, of course, a hefty dose of rye. We feel the rye adds the perfect touch to the overall flavor profile. Since this is an IPA, we also like to use a lot of hops. This brew is close to 50 IBUs and is finished with Columbus. But it doesn’t stop there, we use even more Columbus to dry hop this parade of flavor to compliment this beer nicely with a light citrus note, without overwhelming! Is this more of an American or English style of IPA, you might ask? We feel this is an East Coast IPA - lots of British roots, but with American guts!

So what’s with the name? Hey, we proudly support our Troops & Veterans and thought a bunch of pussycat pilots flying their fighter jets in a parade formation would be fun.

Jayne Cobb might not be from Kentucky, and is by no means a common man, but we were long overdue for a Firefly reference. This semisweet, creamy amber ale is one of America's truly unique styles of beer. Made with almost 30% flaked corn, this style deserves a comeback in a big way

Lucky number 13 is our most classic Pale Ale to date! Pine and resin compliment a roasty nose while pink grapefruit and spruce round out a perfectly balanced palate. This Pale Ale is brewed with 100% MD grown ingredients and showcases one of our favorite traditional hops, Brewer's Gold!

When the little animals in Fairyland hibernate, the Achouffe gnomes love to gather in their cottage.  By the gentle firelight, they spend long evenings telling the best Ardennes stories while enjoying a delicious N’Ice CHOUFFE. Smooth and strong, with spicy notes of thyme and Curacao, this dark beer warms both hearts and atmospheres, making even the coldest winters joyful.

Also sold as Kilkenny Draught.

First Brewed 1710 St Francis Abbey.

Kilkenny Irish Cream Ale, with its deep red hue and rich, creamy head delivers a distinctively smooth and flavourful taste.
Heaps of Citra hops and special ingredients come together with German yeast to create luscious notes of citrusy fruit and holiday spice in this delicious toast to unfiltered holidays.

Red Molly‘s rich character starts with a foundation of authentic Irish Ale malt. Cherry notes and a slight residual sweetness come from Crystal and Munich malts, with a touch of chocolate wheat. A clean bitterness, courtesy of mild British hops, balances the malt complexity and results in a flavorful and refreshing pint.

beer.beer_name: Merry Christmas & Happy New Year (Our Special Ale) (2019)
beer.beer_description:
Slightly darker than last year’s Christmas Ale, the 2019 edition is layered with toasted caramel and coffee flavors with subtle hints of Mexican chocolate, rounded out with herbaceous spices. Crack open a bottle for a spiced whiff of western evergreens, roasted malts, and coastal flowers. It’s a rich, round and full bodied-treat with a silky, smooth finish.

 This year, Stitt illustrated the Western Arborvitae – the “tree of life” – across the label. It is an evergreen conifer native to Northern California, the same region that Anchor has called home for over 123 years. Before modern medicine, properties of Western Arborvitae leaves were believed to have healing properties – hence, the moniker “tree of life.” 2019 Anchor Christmas Ale proudly wears this tree and symbolizes the start of a strong, healthy beginning.

Did you get it? Luggage Assistance…Porter. Sort of a hotel inside joke. The nose on this beer will amaze you, the balance on the palate will have you coming back for more. Sort of like that famous song…“you can check-out anytime you want, but you can never leave!”

The holidays at Tröegs start with our inner Mad Elf momentarily taking over the brew deck. So blame "him" for this cheerful ruby red creation brewed with honey, cherries and Belgian yeast reminiscent of cinnamon, clove and allspice.

We brewed this beer in hopes to emulate a more historical version of a Bohemian-style pilsner.  By using using Weyermann, a light and dark Bohemian floor malt, and fermenting this lager in our open fermenters, we created a richer mouthfeel, a deeper color, and a more "rustic" flavor profile more representative of lagers produced hundreds of years
ago in the Czech Republic; when malts had less consistent attributes and beer was not fermented in tall stainless tanks.
Triple Citra Daydream! You know the drill: oats, lactose and triple dry hopped with Citra and Citra Lupulin powder.
The Gold Medal Winner of the Maryland Comptroller’s Cup for brew made with Maryland ingredients. Its a heavy Rye forward IPA and meant for seriois fans of Rye.

A super-soft and pillowy pale ale hopped exclusively with Vic Secret and Denali, creating a delicious and juicy beer with overtones of overly-ripe pineapple and passionfruit with notes of pine in the background.

With vanilla and cinnamon additions, our American Robust Porter includes Maryland Cascade hops, Zeus hops, black patent malt, chocolate malt and Chico yeast. Inspired by the classic Central American rice milk beverage horchata, this cask is not to be missed!

India Pale Ale with Maryland Cascade hops and Chico yeast. This East Coast Style IPA features an earthy nose and huge malt backbone that is balanced with the citrus and spice of the hop bitterness that lingers to a dry finish.
Winter Coat Season – A strong ale brewed with generous amounts of rich malt, coupled with a taint of cinnamon and mace to keep you warm and toasted all winter long.

beer.beer_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Enigma Daydream
beer.beer_description: One of our favorite Aussie hops gets the Daydream treatment. 2-row, oats, and a hint of lactose with Enigma hops.
Oatmilk IPA brewed with galaxy and motueka hops. Soft oatmeal mouthfeel, smooth blended citrusy flavor.
This 100% MD grown Vienna Lager is roasty, crisp and comforting. Brewed with Chinook and Brewers Gold hops and Vienna Malt from Dark Cloud Malthouse it is a wonderful welcome to the cooler weather!
An easy drinking stout with notes of chocolate and coconut.

In 1810, the Oktoberfest tradition was born when Munich celebrated the Crown Prince’s wedding with a special beer and 16 day party. Our version of this classic style blends rich malts for a hearty, smooth flavor with notes of caramel creating a brew that’s perfect for the season, or whatever you’re celebrating.

beer.beer_name: Wooded Reserve: Rum BA Golden Pastry Stout
beer.beer_description: Introducing the 2nd release in our 2019 Wooded Reserve Series of barrel aged beers; A Golden Stout aged 7 months in 1st use Barbados Rum barrels with coffee & cacao nibs. Barrel aging imparts layers of rum, oak and vanilla notes. Complex, yet simple, the golden stout's subtle sweetness is accentuated by the addition of coffee and cacao.
Cask Only Variant

Brewed with a ridiculous amount of barley, we've now taken this Dogfish Head classic and aged it on oak with real vanilla beans! With a little tender love and care we foster this beer from smooth, sweet wort into the big, bad blackend stout it always longed to be. Its bold, port-like complexity goes great with (or as) dessert.

This Imperial Stout is based on a 100-year-old English recipe for one of the original examples of the style. It includes loads of floor-malted Maris Otter, English amber, brown, and black malts, plus dark candi syrup! Resulting flavors include roasty chocolate, toasted bread, coffee ice cream, and toffee.

The third in our "atomic" series of fruited and dry-hopped sours. This time we added more than 450 lbs of peach puree, and dry hopped with Amarillo and Azacca. We fermented this batch with our House Saison culture, so it ended up drier than the previous entries.

Citra, oats, English yeast, you know the drill.

Rings of Light is the purest expression of Sapwood hoppy beer. We use every trick in our brewing arsenal to saturate it with tropical, citrusy, and melony Citra® hop aromatics. Oats provide a creamy body, while our house ale strain creates a richness too often missing from session beers.

Batch #1 (September, 2018) - 4.8% ABV
Batch #2 (November, 2018) - 5.5% ABV
Batch #3 (February, 2019) - 4.8% ABV
Batch #4 (September, 2019) -
4.5% ABV
Cans/Batch #5 (May, 2020) - 5.0% ABV

The multiple gold-medal winning crown jewel of our lager collection!  We’ve perfected this authentic German recipe for a gorgeous amber Oktoberfest.  Elegantly balanced between satisfying depth of flavor and refreshing drinkability, it’s pure liquid harmony.

Give me liberty, or give me death! Our tribute to Patrick Henry, who not only left his mark on Virginia history, but was also one of our most beloved Founding Fathers. Henry led the opposition to the Stamp Act, but he was also central to arguing in a Virginia court against the King’s right to veto colonial laws. The Crown’s veto was nullified in his efforts and his argument was the first notch in a young Patrick Henry’s career. Cheers to the break from the Crown, Patty! Hope you enjoy our English Brown Ale as a tribute!

This Northern English Brown Ale is filled with a variety of English malts giving it  great caramel, nutty, toffee flavors with a touch of chocolate and even espresso. The English Hops offer the perfect balance to the complex malt sweetness, providing an earthy/grassy hop finish.

Gold medal winner at 2015 Virginia Brewers Cup.
A rich, full bodied amber bock. Brewed with IREKS malt and Hallertau Mittelfruh hops.
Our Cobia Kölsch infused with Orange and vanilla!
Citra, Azacca & amarillo hops
Have your pie and drink it too! Bold in flavor with a deep amber color, our big Baked Pumpkin Ale is sure to remind you of Grandma's pumpkin pie.
Features Centennial, CTZ, and Simcoe.

Full bodies smooth srout witg a taste of sweet oats and slight bitter finish.  It leads with aronas of coffee and chocolate.  The name Grandy Dancer pays homage to the hardworking men who laud the tracks across this great country.

With a little tip of the hat to our scientific, pioneering neighbors we created the innovative atom smasher limited run artisan beer. A heft, full-bodied lager reminiscent of Marzen beers from days gone by. However, this beer is aged in our oak foudres to add a complexity unmatched by the imported version of Oktoberfest beers today. Just add Ledersosen!
This Bavarian-Style Marzen Lager has a smooth, complex malt flavor profile accompanied by a  slight bitterness for easy drinkability.
A traditional German style Marzen with a hint of cherrywood to ring in the arrival of fall, prost!

(White of Chambly) was the first bottle
refermented ale produced by Unibroue. It is
brewed from a blend of pale barley malt,
wheat malt and unmalted wheat, to which
we blend selected spices and hops.
 
Blanche de Chambly is only partially filtered,
retaining its natural cloud of yeast that is
characteristic of the original white ales
brewed during the Middle Ages.

We recommend this remarkably refreshing

Brewed with native Pennsylvania neck pumpkins harvested just a few miles from our brewery, Master of Pumpkins conjures the spirit of autumn by combining traditional pie spices with French saison yeast to elicit notes of vanilla, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg and honey.
Double Dry Hopped Oh… is our crushable wheat and oat IPA with Citra, Citra Lupulin, Galaxy and Motueka.

Classic all malt American Brown Ale with a sweet, malty backbone and a noticeable, but not overpowering, hop presence. 

Kettled Hops: Warrior, Cascade
Dry Hops: Cascade
Malts: American 2-Row, Chocolate, Caramel
Imperial Rye ESB aged in Sagamore Spirit rye whiskey barrels. Also includes Domino brown sugar.

This American Wild Ale features Tee Pee pale malt, raw and malted wheat from Dark Cloud malthouse, Stillpoint Farm Chinook, Cultivale Farm Catoctin Heritage hops and a mixed culture blend of Pediococcus and Brettanomyces Lambicus. After sixteen months in a red wine barrel, it has gained aromas of tropical fruit, smoke, and cut oak. On the palate, No. 8 opens bright and citrus-tart then transitions to pineapple-sweet. A higher carbonation level makes Wild Barrel No. 8 a real treat to enjoy.

beer.beer_name: Green Farmer Pale Ale No. 12 Wet Hop
beer.beer_description: This Wet Hopped Green Farmer is brewed with 100% MD grown ingredients featuring pale malt and malted wheat from Dark Cloud Malthouse, wet Chinook hops from Stillpoint Farm and wet Southern Cross hops from Big Truck Farm. The nose has notes of pine and red grapefruit that lead to a bold spicy and herbal pallet with a clean hoppy finish. This beer truly showcases the terroir of MD ingredients only found at harvest time! Happy Fall!

Hopped extensively with Azacca, Citra, El Dorado, and Mosaic hops and then conditioned on vanilla beans, this monster of a beer is overloaded with flavors of tropical fruits, citrus, and orange-creamsicle. *contains lactose*.

Joint Resolution is a very quaffable Hazy offering that will hit on all the notes hop heads are looking for with a drinkable 5.5% ABV so the hops can play more of a starring role in this aroma-forward IPA. The beer has an approachable level of bitterness incorporating Canadian Pale 2-row, White Wheat, Flaked Oats, Carafoam and Acidulated malts, and a mix of hops including Michigan Copper and Chinook varieties among others. The high protein and dextrin-laden malt bill and aromatic hops of this unfiltered beer contribute flavors akin to Hawaiian fruit punch with mango, orange, tangerine and cannabis flower with overtones of citrus and resin permeating throughout, coming together for total flavor satisfaction.

Not too spicy, not too sweet, and not like any pumpkin beer you’ve had before.  This pumpkin ale was brewed with Saigon Cinnamon and Habanero and De Arbol peppers for an explosion of flavors that’ll keep you coming back for more.
East Kent golding hops.

This is our first foray into the Milkshake IPA style (and it won't be our last). 

We loaded the beer up with tons of Madagascar vanilla, added a few touches of milk sugar and then worked oranges into the mix.  We added both Citra and Mosaic hops to bolster the citrus notes and added a touch of complexity.  

The result... well, we'll let you be the judge.  We get pronounced flavors of silky smooth orange sherbet and as the name suggests, orange creamsicles.  A true treat of an IPA.
Hazy IPA brewed with Cashmere and Mosaic Hops

The Premium Weissbier at the top of its class. Not only in the context of the Erdinger assortment Erdinger Weissbier with fine yeast applies undisputed as the classical authors, as the white beer absolutely. It is brewed with fine yeast after a delivered prescription and naturally strictly after the Bavarian purity requirement. Today still without the traditional bottle fermentation one does not do here: Three to four weeks it lasts, until the Erdinger Weissbier with fine yeast matured. For the production only finest raw materials are used. Experience of many years and constant quality controls guarantee beyond that the unmistakable taste. A Weissbier for all, those the unforgettable good taste love.
Fruity notes from imported Belgian yeast swirl through a precise souring.  Pucker up to a bite of citrus laden tang ending with a delectable experience.
Pours black with a tan head. Sweet nose with chocolate and caramel malt presence. No absence of hops. Cozy like velvet. A lover, not a fighter.
Fruited Sour w/peaches, Vanilla, and Milk Sugar.

German Style Hefeweizen with 100% Maryland ingredients with Thoroughbred 6-row pale malt and malted soft red wheat from our two local malt houses Dark Cloud Malting and Chesapeake Malting along with local Cascade and Brewers Gold hops.  This local interpretation of our traditional Hefeweizen has a faint banana nose with soft clove on the palate that is rounded out with a malty wheat finish and a late honey sweetness from the local malt.

beer.beer_name: They Can't Stop All of Us
beer.beer_description: A hazy double IPA brewed with galaxy and Idaho 7 hops
Double Dry-Hopped Triple India Pale Ale brewed with Mosaic hops, then Double Dry-Hopped with Mosaic + Citra + El Dorado.
With intense flavors of guava, pineapple and apricot coupled with subtle hints of melon, this is sure to keep you reaching for another glass!
Double IPA made with Styrian Cardinal and Pekko hops! It’s our first time using Styrian Cardinal and we love the pineapple passion fruit notes

Brewed in collaboration with Imprint Beer Co. We first tasted a no-boil IPA at Field Dayz from our friends at Imprint Beer, and we were intrigued and inspired. So naturally when they came down to brew with us, we wanted to pay homage to the style. Silky, fruity, and wonderfully complex featuring Galaxy and Mosaic, with plenty of oats to round out the mouthfeel.

Please welcome Country Road to the line up. This golden-y, slow moving Biere de Garde was traditionally brewed in the cold months to drink after a long day in the fields, this puppy is malty, round and caramel-y, and surprisingly thirst quenching. We slowed our roll a bit on this one fermenting at ale temperatures before undergoing a period of extended cold conditioning or “guarding.” This pup was worth the wait. Come take a drive with us.
Mexican-style cerveza.

Real unfiltered lager crafted from the finest hops and barley malt.

Here in Richmond, we're not afraid of doing things the hard way. We are a community of artists, creators and innovators. We respect time honored tradition, craftsmanship and quality over quantity. We go the extra mile, and when the job is done, we know we've earned the right to kick back and enjoy a cold one. For a hard day's work, and whatever follows, we give you Richmond Lager.

We are proud to continue supporting Virginia agriculture. Virginia-grown Cascade hops constitute 20% of the hop bill for Richmond Lager, lending subtle notes of citrus in the finish. A portion of the grain bill incorporates Virginia grown and malted 2-row barley.
A hazy New England IPA with a hint of citrus.

El Guapo — which, translated, means “the handsome one” — looks sexy, smells beautiful, and tastes great! It is a medium-bodied, agave-infused India Pale Ale, with a grassy, citrus nose and notes of sweet caramel, that finishes with a smooth but strong bitterness.
Traditional Belgian-style Witbier brewed with coriander and orange peel.

This rich winter seasonal pours a jet black body with a tan head.  A unique blend of European specialty malt unites to provide bold roasted aromatics followed by flavors of bitter chocolate and freshly brewed coffee.
Juicy fruit and pronounced hop characteristics, medium body, and a mild bitter finish.
Our base belgian wit beer with thai basil added after fermentation.
Our latest hazy offering, featuring Mosaic.  Conan yeast, loads of wheat and oats lay a base to heavy handed doses of mosaic and simcoe hops.

This Green Farmer features 100% pale malt from Dark Cloud Malthouse and a hop bill of Nugget, Cascade and Chinook from Pleasant Valley Hops in Frederick County. Crisp and dry with dank citrus and pine notes, this sessionable American Pale Ale is traditional with a Maryland twist!

480 pounds of Maryland peaches fermented for over 9 months in an oak foeder give this beer bright and tart fruit character that is balanced by an oat heavy malt bill. Reminiscent of your favorite peach pie and perfect for Summer!

A shandy is beer mixed with a little something extra like soda, juice or ginger ale. Leinenkugel’s® Summer Shandy® is a traditional wheat beer with refreshing natural lemonade flavor that makes it perfect for the sun-splashed summer months. For a fun and fresh food pairing, try it with lighter, brighter foods like shrimp quesadillas, pan-seared scallops with lemon vinaigrette, or lemon chicken with pasta.

Ten Years In One Day is the culmination of a decade of homebrewing friendship between our collaborative partners Mike and Scott of Sapwood Cellars, and Rob, our lead brewer. Crafted from a grist of base 2-row, German pilsner, and white wheat, Ten Years In One Day is, simply put, an unabashed display of hop bombast. The tropical cornucopia of Amarillo, Simcoe Cryo, Denali, Citra, Citra Cryo, Simcoe Cryo seamlessly weaves into the distinct stone fruit ester profile of Jailbreak’s house ale yeast, to construct a flavor profile that is greater than the sum of its parts.

For our collaboration with DCBeer.com we wanted to showcase how hoppy a session beer could be. We started with a base resembling an English Bitter, then blasted it with Amarillo and Australian Vic Secret dry hopping. The combination is surprisingly creamy and full bodied for a beer whose fruity and piney hop aroma leaps out of the glass!
Our newest hazy oaty pale ale. This one is hopped with Citra and Idaho 7. Walks the line between bright tropical fruit, and earthy-herbaceousness.

Appearance: Hazy golden in color with a white head
Aroma: grapefruit soda with subtle tropical fruit
Flavor:  Slightly sweet and slightly tart with grapefruit and juicy passionfruit and a crisp and dry finish

OK! OK! I know I look like a fish. I talk like a fish, but forget it! I don’t feel like a fish anymore, things have moved on. I’m a laboratory failure. That’s evolution, Honey! It’s over – find someone else.
- Ralph Steadman

Kicked up Belgian Witbier with honey, orange marmalade, orange peel, coriander, and dry-hopped with Sorachi Ace hops. Loads of citrus flavor and a fresh honey finish with a bright, citrusy hop aroma. This baby is sweet and smooth up front with a touch of bitterness underneath.

Brewed in collaboration with our friends at Cushwa Brewing Co and Sapwood Cellars! Coriolis Force is brewed & dry hopped exclusively with hops grown in the Southern Hemisphere: Motueka from New Zealand, Summer from Australia, and Southern Passion from South Africa. Very crisp & clean and full of unique lemony green tea notes. The perfect lawnmower beer.

beer.beer_name: Dead Rise Old Bay Summer Ale
beer.beer_description:
Dead Rise was brewed to celebrate OLD BAY's 75th anniversary and proceeds benefit True Blue, a program that advocates on behalf of the Chesapeake Bay's 5,500 watermen.

Dead Rise was brewed to highlight the indelible, bold character of OLD BAY with citrus hop notes and a crisp, tart finish. Pair it with tables piled high with shrimp, corn, and Maryland Blue Crab.
Oat IPA with no hops added during the boil or whirlpool. Double dry hopped with Galaxy and Nelson Sauvin.

A juicy wheat IPA with notes of citrus, pineapple and tropical fruit.

Hops: Citra, El Dorado, Amarillo
Malts: Pale, Wheat
American Pale Ale
An intensely satisfying full bodied beer, McEwan’s Scotch Ale has sweet aromas of caramel, toffee, malt bread and dried fruit.

A second sticky hit from 420 Strain, an American Wheat packed with herbal, juicy mango notes and a distinctive dank nose. Strain specific terpenes and natural hemp-type flavors complement the hop and malt bill, delivering a euphoric ale with that fresh olfactory bonus rip.

This limited release Farmhouse Ale was brewed in collaboration with our good friends from Right Proper Brewing Company!  The goal for this one was to mimic the qualities of crisp white wine.  The hop bill consists of Hallertau Blanc and Cascade.  Malt bill features pilsner malt and flaked oats.  The resulting beer displays flavors and aromas of green apple, pear and citrus fruit accompanied by a light body and dry finish.

Welcome to Summer! This beer is a fun twist on one of our favorite brews with additions lemon balm, lemon peel and sweet orange peel. Crispy and refreshing with a clean and dry finish that leaves the palate ready for more!
A full bodied Imperial Stout flavored with vanilla bean and Tupelo Honey, then aged for 3+ months in Bourbon barrels for an exceptionally smooth and delicious finish
A full bodied Imperial Stout flavored with vanilla bean and Tupelo Honey for an exceptionally smooth and delicious finish
Traditional german style Hefeweizen. Hazy with medium body and hints of banana and bubblegum
Barrel aged Dollyhyde Farmhouse = Dollyhyde Beach House

Peeling Drag is a dangerously drinkable pale ale designed for the maximization of flavor! Robust hopping with both Cascade and Citra provide a firm citrus foundation, while measured whirlpool additions of coriander coupled with lemon and orange peels only serve to accentuate and amplify the pre-established hoppy deliciousness. This beer will no doubt quench your thirst while fighting that drag-peeling keeper.

In order to pay homage to the Bavarian classic, we employed as many traditional German brewing techniques as our brewhouse would allow, including retrofitting our brew kettle in order to accept a decoction. Traditionally brewed to be consumed in May, our Maibock is brewed with Weyermann Vienna, Pils, and Munich type 1 malts, and goes through a single decoction plus an extended boil in order to achieve a complexity of malt character that could otherwise not be achieved. Measured bittering doses of Hallertau Mittelfruh hops formulate balance, providing textural structure that serves to maximize drinkability. There are many liters of this in our near future!

A hoppy blonde ale brewed for simple summer sipping. Featuring orchard-like fruit character born from healthy pitches of Motueka & Rakau.

Brewed in collaboration w/ Atlanta indie rock band Rosser and inspired by their single "Tiny Hot Spot".

Light and hazy, Toru is a Riwaka hop showcase with a support base of Nelson Sauvin.
Our late hopping process brings notes of grapefruit, lychee, and lemon to the front, w/ white grape giving balance. A soft mouthfeel and crisp finish, Toru is a wonderful marriage of old school style and new world flavor.
While still holding true to the style, our Belgian Witbier was fermented on blood orange and cranberry purée to give it some bold flavors and depth.
Tart Blackberry English Mild
This NEIPA/Hazy IPA is juicy and soft with tropical fruit notes from El Dorado, Azacca and Ekuanot hops.
Everyone loves a good cup of coffee in the morning, well here you go! Another easy to drink beer with a good upfront roasted finish abd creamy body...cheers!
This Flemish-style red ale is brewed with Belgian malts and fermented with traditional Flemish souring agents.  This ale is aged in French Oak Barrels with apricots for a tart and refreshing finish
Brewed with agave nectar and lime peel, it's the artisanal answer to the easy-drinking, south-of-the-border light lagers.
So juicy, brah. Thunderpeel Hazy IPA is brewed with Citra, Galaxy, Mosaic, and is unfiltered for your pleasure.
Hazy IPA brewed and double dry hopped with Galaxy, Comet, and Citra!
Brewed with sweet orange peels, lactose, and a bit of vanilla bean , it has a bit of a creamy moderate body but a nice tartness to keep it refreshing.

"Good girls want him bad. Bad girls want him worse."

Rye Baby IPA ain't for no squares! 

Brewed with floor malted English Marris Otter and a hefty charge of rye malts, this beer brings a spicy malt presence to the scene. But its the hops that are the stars of this hep ale. We hopped Rye Baby with copious amounts of Chinook and Simcoe hops and then dryhopped it with a blend of the two to give it an amazing hop character that will make you the baddest delinquent in Baltimore! We think Rye Baby is a delicious beer that you'll be burning inside to drink, and if that's a crime we'll stand convicted!
Lemony citrus flavor up front, diving into a malty finish. Crisp and refreshing with a soft mouth-feel from the flaked grains.
Our classic Dollyhyde Farmhouse fermented with Biere de Garde yeast. Round fruity esters give way to soft spice notes making this rustic farmhouse a new favorite.
Mile Marker is an easy going hazy IPA with a huge punch to the nose of fruity aromas. It goes down with a lot of orange zestiness that keeps you coming back after mile after mile.

Our flagship beer, Loose Cannon wins people over at first smell. The carefully cultivated interplay of Simcoe, Palisade, and Centennial creates a most fragrant IPA—its nose bursts with notes of grapefruit, herbs, and pine. Bitterness is somewhat subdued by the floral quality that pervades the taste. The color is burnished gold, and the mouthfeel is creamy. A strong malt backbone balances out the triple-hopped beer. Its nickname, Hop3, comes from the brewing process: our brewers hop Loose Cannon in the boil, the hopback, and the fermenter. It won a second place CAMRA award at the 2010 Great British Beer Festival.

Blackbird Singing is a Cascadian Dark Ale with a full body and seductively assertive pine and resin hop characteristics that meld with it's intoxicating burnt sugar, chocolate, and subtle fruity backbone. At 9.7% this one will surely have you singing in the dead of night!
An unfiltered premium lager gratuitously hopped with German Saphir and Tettnang to lend lime zest and floral aromatics.
We love Pilsner for its simplicity. We brew ours with German-grown Pilsner malt, Magnum and Saaz hops– and water and yeast of course. Clean, dry, and refreshing. That’s it, that’s all.

Just in time for the warm weather, this 5.6% crushable classic American Wheat is built on a base of 2-row and white wheat, then hopped and dry-hopped with Citra, Amarillo, and Centennial. Bright and crisp with aromas of citrus, pine, and the last day of school. Go for height. Stay away from the edge.
A dark American Amber Ale with a slight malty flavor and a mild hop tone, a refreshing session ale.
An English brown ale with a slight brown sugar flavor leaving a hint of sweetness. It's one of our most popular beers because of it's smoothness.

With over 400 pounds of wild fermented foeder aged Maryland grown red plums, this Farm de Garde has notes of delicate funky fruit on the nose that lead   ripe plum with a well rounded tartness on the palate.
Sour ale juiced with loads of citrus fruit flavor
Hazy IPA brewed with oats, flaked barley & honey malt. Hopped with Citra, El Dorado, and Simcoe.
Nitro Cream Ale brewed with Cinnamon, Apricot, and Lactose

We infused House Saison #2 with flowers from the thyme and sage growing in front of Mike's house. They add an herbal flavor, creating depth with the hops. In addition homegrown lemon verbana brightens the beer, creating a vibrant counterpoint to the funky Brettanomyces.

Our brand-new pale ale is in the mold of Rings of Light and Danger of Light, but with a more complex blend of hop aromatics from the combination of 50% Australian Galaxy, with 25% each Mosaic and Citra. The result has tropical fruit (passionfruit, papaya) with citrus and some dank herbaceous notes.

A lightly-hoppy wine-influenced wheat beer.

Wine and beer aren't enemies. Vintners have been selecting cultures that enhance the naturally fruity flavors of grapes. Luckily hops contain many of the same aromatic compounds. So We tried boost the already fruity aroma of German Huell Melon hops with the small addition of wine yeast. The result is all strawberry and cantaloupe with a smooth low-bitterness base.

We opened September 2018 with a beer called False Dragon. It was an imitator of the true Dragon Reborn. This is a stronger beer, with a small amount of flaked rye for an even creamier body. We dry hopped with the same combination of Hallertau Blanc and Mosaic, but this time used Cryo Mosaic for an even punchier dank-winey aroma. This beer is fermented with a strain we're using for the first time, pushing stonefruit aromatics.

With over 400 pounds of wild fermented foeder aged Maryland grown nectarines, this Farm de Garde has notes of toasted meringue and bright funky fruit on the nose that lead  bold ripe nectarine with a well rounded tartness on the palate.
A gose style ale with apricot brewed in collaboration with Antietam Brewery in Hagerstown, MD.

An aggressively hopped West Coast-style IPA.  Union Jack showcases exceptional dry hop character with stunning pineapple, citrus and piney aromas on the nose accompanied by honey-like malt aromatics.  Double dry hopping brings bold grapefruit, tangerine and citrus flavors that are contrasted by pale malt sweetness to balance this intense brew.  A true tribute to the style that put the West Coast on the craft beer map.
Peppery, full-bodied farmhouse ale.
Dark ale with a peppery bite and some fruity notes. The nitro gives it a silky, creamy finish.

English Style Bitter with Maryland Cascade hops, Carroll County wild flower honey and Chico yeast.  Traditional English Style bitter with a delicate hop balance of earth and spice. Naturally carbonated served at cellar temperature.

Our 10th Green Farmer is brewed with all locally grown ingredients including 2 row pale from Chesapeake Malting and all of the hops are from Big Truck Farm in Baltimore County. A complex aroma of ripe fruit, citrus, and pine leads the way to a thirst quenching and dry finish.

This sweet yet dry beer is made with ingredients found in 2,700-year-old drinking vessels from the tomb of King Midas. Somewhere between beer, wine and mead, Midas will please the chardonnay and beer drinker alike.

Tune in and hop out with New Belgium Citradelic. Set adrift on a kaleidoscopic wave of hoppiness brought to you by a mystical marriage of Citra hops and tangerine peel, which elevates each sip onto a plane of pure tropical, fruity pleasure.
Citradelic’s namesake hop and fruit combine to jam with visions of additional hops like citrusy Mandarina Bavaria, tropical Azzaca, and fruity Galaxy for a colorful explosion that’s grounded by just a touch of malty sweetness. Bored by the status quo? Expand your palate with a pour of Citradelic.

Hops - Nugget, Crystal, Centennial, Azzaca, Cascade, Citra, Chinook, Galaxy, Mandarina Bavaria, Simcoe.

Matls - Pale, Caramel 120. 

Tangerine infused orange peel.
The ferry crossing connection of Brunswick to their German neighbors in Lovettsville along the Potomac River was known as the "German Crossing".

The dream begins with open-top fermentation. At high krausen, a rocky foamy head crests the sides of the fermenter releasing notes of black pepper and spicy clove. Unfiltered and cloudy with yeast, it’s slightly tart and downright refreshing.

beer.beer_name: Pitchfork Pale Ale (Lemon Drop Single Hop)
beer.beer_description: Our Pitchfork Pale Ale single hopped with lemon drop hops.
A Belgian Golden Strong Ale with a bright Orange flavor and a creamy head.  This ale is brewed with Orange Blossom Honey, Bitter Orange Peel and Bavarian Mandarina hops.
Lactosimplicity is a hazy IPA brewed with lactose sugar, Madagascar vanilla and a blend of Idaho 7, Amarillo, and Huell Melon hops.
Tart, Meyer-lemon flavor. Hints of orange, tangerine, grapefruit and lemongrass
A traditional Belgian Style Tripel Trappist Ale brewed with Belgian Malts and light Belgian Candi sugar
Hazy IPA brewed with tons of oats with Mosaic, Falconers Flight, and Columbus in the boil and double dry hop. Great combination of both dank and fruity that this series is known for!

This Hazy Rye IPA was brewed with our good friend Steve Judge!  It was heavily hopped with Simcoe, Centennial, Cascade and Falconer's Flight.  The resulting beer carries notes of citrus fruit, pine and rye spice throughout the aroma and flavor profile.

This 100% Maryland grown Native Ale is the sister to Native Barrel No. 6 with Tee Pee pale malt, malted and raw wheat from Dark Cloud malthouse, Stillpoint Farm Chinook, Cultivale Farm Catoctin Heritage hops and a mixed culture of our native farm yeast and Brett Brux. Aromas of bold tropical fruit, funky oak and light smoke are followed by light citrus and bright tartness on the palate and that lead to a quick and clean finish. We believe that our Native Series is a wonderful showcase of the diversity of Maryland terroir.
A full bodied milk stout that is like drinking chocolate milk. We added roasted cocoa nibs from Ghana, Madagascar Vanilla, and a generous helping of toasted pecans. Great alone or on ice cream!
This entry into our fruited Smoothie series is Blackberry forward with mellow vanilla notes.

In honor of the 200th anniversary of Francis Scott Key’s penning of The Star Spangled Banner just outside of Fort McHenry right here in Baltimore, we’ve brewed up this easy drinking, all-American beer. Our take on a classic American style, the Cream Ale, this light golden ale is brewed with American grown barley, wheat, corn, & oats and lightly hopped with Columbus for bittering and a kiss of floral Mosaic. This all-American classic is just the thing to make you sing!

From the shadows of a dark and opulent curtain spring the robust aromas of locally roasted coffee and hardy malt. Deep-seated hop bitterness rallies with these conspirators, delivering a well-balanced thrust of assertive flavor to a bland tyrant. Raise a glass in celebration of liberating taste. “Et tu, Brewte?”
Modelo Negra Mexican Beer is a lager beer with German roots, offering a rich taste with a light finish. Enjoy this cerveza on its own or to brings out the flavors of Mexican dishes.
The restrained bitterness, and spice of our equinox saison is complimented by the addition of local fermented strawberries.
German style Helles Bock. Robust malty flavor with a light hop finish.

This was created to bring the world of English Mild Ales together with American Ambers.  We use 9 different types of malt together to provide you with a unique experience while still maintaining a nice balance of flavors.  The result is a copper colored brew with a big white head.  Aromas of caramel malt complexity and light berries come through on the nose.  The flavor profile is incredibly smooth with more caramel along with a touch of biscuit that’s followed by a clean finish.

Sweet grainy malt and faint floral nose. Our most
consistent seller for good reason. Perfectly balanced
lager that finishes crisp, clean and light on the palette.
‘Sour Me Tangelo’ mixes the inherent mouth puckering flavors of the brew with big citrus notes, sweet tangerine & a subtly bitter grapefruit flavor for a perfect blend of tart and sweet.

Newcastle Brown Ale is a brand of beer produced by Heineken International. The beer was introduced in 1927 in Newcastle upon Tyne, England, by Newcastle Breweries, which became Scottish & Newcastle in 1960. In 2005, brewing was moved out of Newcastle for the first time to the other side of the River Tyne, to Dunston in Gateshead. In 2009, it was announced that production would move to Tadcaster North Yorkshire.
Brewed with 100% Maryland grown ingredients, this Lager is crisp and fruity with notes of citrus that lead to a smooth and dry finish.
This beautiful, deep russet brew has the sweet and somewhat nutty character of Adam Avery's late (1992-2002) Chocolate Lab, for which it is named.

beer.beer_name: Raven Special Lager 20th Anniversary Premium Edition
beer.beer_description: In 1996, The Raven Special Lager, named after Edgar A. Poe's classic poem was conceived in Germany and purposely marketed as an American themed beer.  The Raven arrived to Baltimore in 1998.  After 20 years, The Raven still remains our flagship brand among 6 other Poe-themed beers.  This anniversary edition is a special thanks to all those who gave their support throughout the years- we made this beer for you.  The Taste is Poetic!
Silky soft and smooth mouthfeel with a slightly roasted coffee and nutty flavor profile.
Coffee and chocolate notes, smooth and easy drinking stout!

Our 9th Green Farmer is brewed with 100% Maryland grown ingredients and feature hops all from Black Locust Hops in Baltimore County. Tropical aromas are met with bright citrus notes on the palate and end with a crisp dry finish. Refreshing and crushable, this Pale Ale has us excited for Spring!
An American IPA brewed to support Sierra Nevada's camp fire relief fund.

Originally a small-batch release in the spring of 2013. Bloodline is brewed with blood orange peel and blood orange juice and hits the perfect balance between  citrus sweetness and bitterness.

Bloodline begins with huge grapefruit on the nose. Then, a delicate balance of citrus sweetness and bitterness. Try it with grilled light proteins, salads with fruity vinaigrettes, and fresh salsa.
Post boil pale ale with Blood Orange added
Get that fire started with a refreshing mead that features vanilla, cocoa nibs, and clove. It's sure to keep you warm all winter long. This is our winter seasonal.

Welcome to the world of bright, citrus and tropical fruit forward IPA’s.  This divinely hoppy brew will pour a hazy golden color with a big white head.  Aromas of lemon peel, tangerine, and passion fruit come through on the nose with some dank undertones.  The flavor profile begins with an intense hop character that is complimented by slightly sweet malt finish.

Our first stout! We took a recipe for a Scottish Wee Heavy and stout-ified it. All the ingredients were from the UK, including Golden Promise pale malt and roasted barley. We boiled 20 gallons of the sweet wort for six hours to create 4 gallons of thick syrup with intense caramelized flavors.
While we're nuts about Threat Level Midnight, not everyone is... until now! We added more than a pound of dry roasted pistachios to each five gallon keg for a toasty, rich, nutty stout!

Our American take on hefeweizen adds pineapple notes from Denali hops to the banana and vanilla from the yeast strains.

Batch #1 - 4.2%
Batch #2 - 5.4%

Awarded Best Beer in Maryland by the Brewers Association at the 2018 Commissioners Cup. Supremely sessionable Eastern Shore take on a Czech style pilsner. Golden in color with floral and citrus zest hop characteristics. Crisp with delicate malt flavors and a dry finish.
Winter-inspired pilsner brewed with Oregon spruce tips which add sweetness and slight piney, citrusy nuances.

This Bière de Garde Gold is brewed with 100% MD grown grains to create a bright, fruity and malty  backbone with faint caramel and biscuit character. Complex and full bodied with a soft and dry finish, this beer is the perfect transition to Fall.

Blood Red Sky sets a scene. Warm Caribbean sand, flickering candles, cold beer and anticipation of the night to come. From this place came the inspiration for this brew. Jamaican rum barrels meet Scottish red beer in an explosion of cool, spicy rum notes, vanilla and rich fruit.

We brew Blood Red Sky using our unique barrel into beer method, turning the traditional beer into barrel process on its head without losing any of the wonderful flavours and aromas from the barrel.

5.2% ABV on draught.
Smooth and roasty stout pumped up with loads of chocolate, flaked oats, and a cold addition of Zekes coffee.

beer.beer_name: Barrel Aged Coppermine Creek Dry Stout
beer.beer_description: Aged in American Oak, this Dry Irish Stout was brewed with Maryland Cascade hops, roasted barley, flaked barley and Chico yeast.  Our traditional Dry Stout has notes of coffee and dark chocolate with low hop bitterness and a smooth and dry finish.
Our year-round kettle sour, hit with whirlpool Mosaic hops, and then tons of fresh raspberries and Mosaic hops in the tank.  Ultra-refreshing!

Bock ‘em Danno is a traditional Bock beer, which is a dark lager, originating from Germany, that was traditionally brewed in the fall and consumed in the spring. Modern bocks have become more common for the holiday season. Bock ‘em Danno has a nice malt character and light chocolate notes. This beer is crisper and less sweet than a brown ale which is a result of the lager vs ale yeast. Whether you’re a fan of the new Hawaii Five-O, you prefer the original, or are new to the series entirely, you are sure to love “Bock ‘em Danno”.

Fat Tire Amber is the easy-drinking Amber Ale born in Colorado from New Belgium Brewing Company, a certified B-Corp. 

Malts: Pale, C-80, Munich, Victory

Hops: Willamette, Goldings, Nugget

Yeast: House Ale Yeast

Medium bodied, red colored beer. Resinous hop aroma and flavor combined with the slight spice imparted by the rye make for a unique take on a hoppy beer. This is for hopheads and fans of bold beer. Hops: Bravo, Chinook, Eureka.

The Grisette is an old working class Belgian Farmhouse style that is typically brewed with wheat.  This take on the classic style is a very light and sessionable farmhouse ale with subtle citrus flavor.  A fluffy white head crowns this straw colored brew.  Aromas of tropical fruit and grass come through on the nose.  The flavor profile is dominated by citrus and slight bitter hops with a dry finish.
Our Plum Farmhouse is back and better than ever! Rich vanilla from American Oak and deep plum notes are followed by bright and lightly tart finish.

Put on your parka. Lace up those snow boots. Walk outside and soak up that 27 minutes of sunlight. It’s winter! After a long day of sliding across icy parking lots on your face, there’s no better way to beat back the cold than with K-9 Winter Warmer, a strong English ale teeming with deep malty flavor and nutty spiciness. Pull up a seat by the fireplace with a slice of spice cake or a bowl of hearty stew, and let K-9 thaw your soul in ways a Snuggie™ never could.

This is an aggressive ale. You probably won’t like it. It is quite doubtful that you have the taste or sophistication to be able to appreciate an ale of this quality and depth. We would suggest that you stick to safer and more familiar territory–maybe something with a multi-million dollar ad campaign aimed at convincing you it’s made in a little brewery, or one that implies that their tasteless fizzy yellow beverage will give you more sex appeal. Perhaps you think multi-million dollar ad campaigns make things taste better. Perhaps you’re mouthing your words as you read this.
Not quite IPA, not quite summer wheat, but a Hoppy Wheat Beer with Citrus Peel.

This 100% Maryland grown Native Ale features Tee Pee pale malt, malted and raw wheat from Dark Cloud malthouse, Stillpoint Farm Chinook, Cultivale Farm Catoctin Heritage hops and a native yeast from our favorite Stillpoint Farm Elm tree. After nine months in a red wine barrel, it has gained aromas of pineapple, funky oak and light smoke followed by bright citrus and botanical notes on the palate leading to a clean and dry finish. Native Barrel No. 6 is a true showcase of the terroir of central Maryland.
Our local take on the hot new IPA! Brewed with ingredients that can be grown right here in MD, this delightfully refreshing Brut is fruit forward with a crisp clean finish.

This sun-kissed pretty bird is named Dinkel for the German word for spelt. Spelt is a heritage grain and was used in the first known beers brewed by the Sumerians. And boy are we happy with this sweet little Belgian charmer. Golden and bright, with notes of spun sugar, nectarine, and honeysuckle, she’s the perfect beer to welcome in fall bbq weather and long patio evenings.

Rye forward with a smooth transition to juicy flavors and a full body to round it out.  Finishes crisp and clean.  Citra, Cascade and Simcoe Cryo hops play nicely   with a yeast strain that contributes to the bright flavors, leaving just a touch of haze.
A hoppy American IPA with the addition of orange and flaked oats.

The juice of red, ripe Louisiana strawberries, harvested at the peak of the season, gives this crisp lager its strawberry flavor, aroma and haze. Made with pilsner and wheat malts and Vanguard hops, all our Harvest Series brews are made with the finest Louisiana-grown ingredients.

Over the years we have toned down the malt grist while upping the hop profile, creating am America Pale Ale, rich and fruity, yet finishes crisp. We're sure that you'll love the copper amber color and medium body.
